questions.question_text: Which of the following describes three-tier architecture?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Trick question, but only option B is SPECIFICALLY mentioned in Project+ objectives. Development, testing, and production is for software engineering.
A three-tier design involves presentation, application, and data, per Certmaster Project+
This is a bad question. Ambiguous. Both B and D are theoretically correct.

comments.content: Agreed. This one is annoying because it requires the reader to assume context. I was originally picking the wrong answer of D, as I'm used to seeing those environments in software engineering scenarios. I think this is a question that was meant more for the PMP...

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
After reviewing this again, I agree with B.
pg. 170 "The Official CompTIA Project+ Guide" - the bottom tier is Data, middle is Application, top tier is Presentation.

Selected Answer: B
B is correct

Selected Answer: D
The answer is D - Development, testing, and production environment.
(pg 375 from "The Official CompTIA Project+ Guide")

comments.content: This is wrong, those aren't tiers. The answer is B.

questions.question_text: After determining the appropriate maintenance window, which of the following should occur NEXT in the operational infrastructure change process?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The project manager should develop a rollback plan next after determining the appropriate maintenance window in the operational infrastructure change process. A rollback plan is a contingency plan that describes how to revert to the previous state of the system or infrastructure in case of a failure or disruption during the change implementation. A rollback plan can help to minimize the impact and risk of the change and ensure business continuity and stability.

Selected Answer: D
Infrastructure change, big problems could occur that would effect the business in a major way - so they need to have a rollback plan in case things go wrong.

Selected Answer: D
According to Google Gemini
D. Develop a rollback plan.

Here's why:

 A. Implement the change: This would happen later in the process, after developing and testing the change, and only during the pre-determined maintenance window.
 B. Approve the test plan: While approving the test plan is important, it typically precedes determining the maintenance window as the window depends on the test schedule and potential downtime impact.
 C. Notify customers: Depending on the organization's policies and the impact of the change, customer notification might happen before or after developing the rollback plan, but it's not the immediate next step.
 D. Develop a rollback plan: This is a crucial step after defining the maintenance window and before implementing the change. It ensures you have a clear strategy to revert to the previous state if any issues arise during the change, minimizing downtime and impact.

Selected Answer: B
▪ Initiating the request
▪ Evaluating the impacts
▪ Making a decision on the outcome = B
▪ Implementing the change

Selected Answer: D
In the operational infrastructure change process, after determining the appropriate maintenance window, the next step usually involves developing a rollback plan (Option D). A rollback plan outlines the steps that will be taken to revert the system back to its original state in case the implemented changes cause issues or fail to meet their objectives. This is an essential part of risk management and ensures that there is a safe way to return to a known, stable state if the change doesn't go as planned.

Selected Answer: D
100% It is D

Selected Answer: D
Develop a rollback plan

questions.question_text: Which of the following offers administrators more direct control over operating systems?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
IaaS gives you the hardware from the cloud provider. PaaS the CSP (Cloud Service Provider) gives you the hardware & OS (platform) which they maintain. IaaS allows you to install and control the Operating System.

Selected Answer: A
How can be D the correct answer? If I have IaaS I can customize everything from infrastrucutre up

Selected Answer: A
IaaS gives most control to the subscriber. It goes IaaS PaaS FaaS and then SaaS in terms of most control -> least control.

Selected Answer: A
This question is so simple and the answer,too!! A!!!

Selected Answer: A
IaaS...they just provide the hardware. PaaS has no control over OS, only applications. SaaS has no control on anything.

Selected Answer: A
A is correct

Selected Answer: C
C is the correct answer. According to ChatGPT, the Pareto chart is used to identify the most significant or critical problems or causes, so that resources can be allocated effectively to address them. It helps to prioritize the areas of improvement and focus on the problems or causes that have the greatest impact.

Selected Answer: C
Simply put the Pareto Diagram is used to "'RANK THE IMPORTANCE' of a problem based on it frequency of occurrence over time. CompTIA Project+ Study Guide PK0-005 3rd Edition

Selected Answer: C
Pareto chart sorts occurrences by their amount.

Selected Answer: C
C is da wey

Selected Answer: C
It's C

questions.question_text: During a quality analysis review, the causes of several issues have been highlighted. Which of the following should the project manager use to identify the MOST important causes?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BE
Home address & date of birth. Work phone / time zone / job title are too generic, although in most organizations (and I myself consider it to be so) this would absolutely be PII. Blood type is PHII.

Selected Answer: BE
B. Home address
E. Date of birth

Here's why:

 Job title: While sensitive in some contexts, it's generally not considered PII on its own unless it can be uniquely linked to an individual and used to identify them.
 Work phone number: Similar to job title, it depends on the organization and potential for identification. It might be considered PII in certain contexts.
 Time zone: It's not directly linked to an individual's identity and doesn't pose a privacy risk by itself.
 Blood type: This is sensitive medical information and definitely falls under PII protection.

questions.question_text: Which of the following items must be protected as PII? (Choose two.)
